ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say it's a pretty good overview of some of the important signaling pathways. But I really do think it would be better if the organization was changed.

Basically a more in-depth version of Principles of Pharm and Structural Pharm that focuses on signaling molecules. This becomes extremely evident when professors give the same lecture in both courses.

I would absolutely recommend the class to a fellow student. The class does an excellent job at touching on all of the principles that we need as researchers in the Pharmacology Department. I would summarize the class as a survey-style class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was helpful in teaching me the details of signaling pathways that were tangentially connected to my field of study that I hadn't had time to study in detail yet. It was a nice overview.

This course (especially the first few lectures on kinases and phosphatases) was helpful in my early preparations for my qualifying exam. A few of the techniques mentioned in measuring signaling may be helpful in my research.
I work in a lab that studies signal transduction, so it would be easier to list topics covered in the class that I DON'T need to know, hah. It is very much a useful course for my personal research...
